<<<<<<< HEAD
A modest and peaceable inquiry into the design and nature of some of those historical mistakes that are found in Dr. Stillingfleet's preface to his Unreasonableness of separation wherein the innocency of Protestant dissenters is cleared up and vindicated from the indecent censures of the doctor / by N. B. Humfrey, John, 1621-1719. Lobb, Stephen, d. 1699.
[8], 44 p.
Printed for Tho. Parkhurst ..., London : 1681.
By John Humfrey and Stephen Lobb. Cf. Halkett and Laing (2nd ed.) Reproduction of original in the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library.
=======

B. Humfrey, John, 1621-1719. Lobb, Stephen, d. 1699.
[8], 44 p.
Printed for Tho. Parkhurst ..., London : 1681.
